titles: New-Babels confusion. Or, Severall votes of the Commons assembled in Parliament; against certain papers, entituled, The agreement of the people for a firm and present peace upon grounds of common right. Delivered to them in the name of all the freeborn people of England. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that these votes be forthwith printed and published. H. Elsynge, Cler' Parl' D. Com'.
author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
Prynne, William, 1600-1669.
publisher: Printed for Edward Husband, printer to the Honourable House of Commons, 1647; and re-printed for Michael Spark at the blue-Bible in Green-arbor,
notes: Excerpts from the proceedings of the Commons, Nov.-Dec. 1647.

First published in 1647, without Prynne's note, as: Several votes of the Commons assembled in Parliament, against certain papers delivered in to them in the name of all the freeborn people of England.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Agreement of the people for a firme and present peace, upon grounds of common-right and freedome.
